The Aichi Scholarship Program is a scholarship program for students from various Asian and Pacific countries to study in Japan in development-related fields including economics, management, science and technology.

Asian scholarships for students currently working in economy and finance within a government agency (e.g. ministry of trade) to study in Japan in a related field. Open only to students from selected Asian countries.
Government scholarships to study in Japan on a graduate-level research program.
Study abroad scholarships for doctorate holders wishing to conduct research in Japan at a selected institution.
Full-tuition international scholarships to study in Japan within any field at Keio University.
Scholarship for Africans to study in Japan on a development-related masterâ€™s degree program at an accredited university.
Scholarships for students from various Asian and Pacific countries to study in Japan in development-related fields including economics, management, science and technology.
International scholarships for students of medicine, pharmacology, nutrition, physical education or business administration to study in Japan.
Over 100 study abroad scholarships for international graduate students to undertake academic research at the University of Tokyo.
